name: CreateSshSigningKeyGithub
description:
Create an SSH signing key for your GitHub account.

This tool allows authenticated users to create an SSH signing key for their GitHub account. Authentication is required via Basic Authentication or OAuth with the `write:ssh_signing_key` scope. It should be used when you need to add SSH signing keys to your GitHub profile.

parameters.name: public_ssh_key
parameters.description: The public SSH key to add to your GitHub account. Check for existing SSH keys before adding.

value_schema.description: The public SSH key to add to your GitHub account. For more information, see "[Checking for existing SSH keys](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/authentication/connecting-to-github-with-ssh/checking-for-existing-ssh-keys)."

parameters.name: ssh_key_title
parameters.description: A descriptive name for the new SSH signing key.

value_schema.description: A descriptive name for the new key.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

value_schema.description: The public SSH key to add to your GitHub account. For more information, see "[Checking for existing SSH keys](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/authentication/connecting-to-github-with-ssh/checking-for-existing-ssh-keys)."

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: A descriptive name for the new key.
